It's the movie equivalent of a cartoon native mascot.

Пора говорить ПРЯМО. ВСЁ ИСКУССТВО: КИНО, ТЕАТР, МУЗЫКА, КНИГИ, ПОЭЗИЯ, ЖИВОПИСЬ имеет ИСКЛЮЧИТЕЛЬНО ДВА ГЛОБАЛЬНЫХ СМЫСЛА , либо служит ПРОСЛАВЛЕНИЮ БОЖЬЕГО СЛОВА , либо дьяволу. СЛУЖИТЬ БОЖЬЕМУ СЛОВУ это значит , каждым КАДРОМ, РЕПЛИКОЙ, КУПЛЕТОМ и т.п. "ПРИВОДИТЬ" НАС, ЗРИТЕЛЕЙ, СЛУШАТЕЛЕЙ к ПОКАЯНИЮ, СПАСЕНИЮ ДУШИ, и соответственно наоборот, максимально удалять от него.

Что касается этого ФИЛЬМА. Человек надевает на себя некий костюм и оказывается в другом мире, мир который пытаются уничтожить ради полезных ископаемых. ЭТО ОБРАЗ. Где человек одевающий на себя костюм это душа, другой мир это параллельный мир(царствие небесное) для наших душ. Но особого объяснения требует что значит укротить, «соединится» с ужасными животными этого мира. Дело вот в чём. Любой человек вставший на праведный путь, жизнь по заповедям Божьим (заповедям Нового Завета), начинает ИСПОЛНЯТЬ главное ПРЕДНАЗНАЧЕНИЕ ИСТИННОЙ ВЕРЫ В БОГА, которое ЗАКЛЮЧАЕТСЯ В «БОРЬБЕ» каждого ЧЕЛОВЕКА, ПРИ ЗЕМНОЙ ЖИЗНИ, СО своими собственными ПОРОЧНЫМИ СТРАСТЯМИ, И только ТАК можно получить СПАСЕНИЕ для своей ДУШИ. Так вот животные этого мира в фильме это образ демонов мучителей разных порочных страстей, от которых и надо человеку избавляться. Самая большое и зловещее животное которое удалось укротить главному герою, это демон мучитель порочной страсти лукавства, самый сильный демон среди всех демонов мучителей человека. И соединится с ними это значит ПОЛУЧИТЬ ОТ ГОСПОДА нашего ИИСУСА ХРИСТА НАУЧЕНИЕ, КАКИМ ОБРАЗОМ можно ПОБЕДИТЬ В СЕБЕ СВОИХ ДЕМОНОВ, НАПРАВИТЬ ИХ ПРОТИВ того кто ими управляет, ДЬЯВОЛА. В фильме образ дьявола это завоеватели, пытающиеся военным путём, уничтожить жителей этого мира ради полезных ископаемых. И вот как БЫЛО БЫ ХОРОШО, ЧТОБЫ КАЖДЫЙ зритель ПОНИМАЛ это. НО ЭТО очень «тонкие» моменты, ПОНЯТЬ которые МОЖНО будет ТОЛЬКО ЧИТАЯ, И ГЛАВНОЕ, ИЗУЧАЯ КНИГУ ЖИЗНИ, СВЯТОЕ ЕВАНГЕЛИЕ.

Да и ПОРОЧНЫЕ СТРАСТИ это ГОРДЫНЯ, ТЩЕСЛАВИЕ, ЛУКАВСТВО, СЕБЯЛЮБИЕ, ТРУСОСТЬ, ЧЕЛОВЕКОУГОДИЕ, ЗАВИСТЬ, ЖАДНОСТЬ, ОСУЖДЕНИЕ, АЛЧНОСТЬ, СКУПОСТЬ, СРЕБРОЛЮБИЕ, ЛИЦЕМЕРИЕ, УНЫНИЕ, ЧРЕВОУГОДИЕ, ГНЕВ, РЕВНОСТЬ, ВОРОВСТВО, РАЗДРАЖЕНИЕ, ВЛАСТОЛЮБИЕ, ПОХОТЬ, ЛЮБОПЫТСТВО, ПЬЯНСТВО, КУРЕНИЕ, ПРЕЛЮБОДЕЯНИЕ, ОБИДЧИВОСТЬ, ЗАСТЕНЧИВОСТЬ, ХИТРОСТЬ и т.д. и т.п. И у КАЖДОГО ЧЕЛОВЕКА своя(СТРАСТЬ), так сказать, ЛИЧНАЯ. И ЭТО всё БОЛЕЗНИ, но БОЛЕЗНИ ДУХОВНОГО ПЛАНА

А ПОЧЕМУ мы ВСЕ БОЛЬНЫ. После ГРЕХОПАДЕНИЯ АДАМА и ЕВЫ они были ИЗГНАНЫ ИЗ РАЯ. ДО грехопадения они ЖИЛИ В РАЮ подобно АНГЕЛАМ. После, БОГ одел их в «одежды» что значит в тела, и ДАЛ ЗАПОВЕДЬ «ПЛОДИТЕСЬ и РАЗМНОЖАЙТЕСЬ» и заселяйте Землю. НО для размножения, В ПОЛОВЫЕ ОТНОШЕНИЯ ПРИХОДИЛОСЬ ВСТУПАТЬ БРАТУ С СЕСТРОЙ. И ЭТО было вызвано необходимостью а НЕ ПОХОТЬЮ . И ВОТ ПОЧЕМУ КАЖДЫЙ рождающийся ребёнок уже ГРЕШЕН. Только не физическое(физическое если вызвано похотью), а так называемое ПЕРВОРОДНОЕ (ДУХОВНОЕ , ПРИЧИНА которого ГРЕХОПАДЕНИЕ) ПОВРЕЖДЕНИЕ(ГРЕХ, ПОРОЧНАЯ СТРАСТЬ) НА КАЖДОМ человеке при рождении. И У КАЖДОГО человека своя СОБСТВЕННАЯ СТРАСТЬ. И ЭТО БОЛЕЗНИ , но БОЛЕЗНИ прежде всего ДУХОВНОГО ПЛАНА. И именно ПОРОЧНЫЕ СТРАСТИ людей являются ПРИЧИНОЙ ВСЕХ БЕД, СТРАДАНИЙ, и РАЗРУШИТЕЛЬНЫХ ДЕЙСТВИЙ на Земле. А вот условия ОСВОБОЖДЕНИЯ от этого ПЕРВОРОДНОГО ГРЕХА(ПОВРЕЖДЕНИЯ, СТРАСТИ) как раз и ЗАПИСАНЫ в КНИГЕ ЖИЗНИ, СВЯТОМ ЕВАНГЕЛИЕ. СНАЧАЛА в мир БЫЛ "ПОСЛАН" для этого СЫН БОЖИЙ ИИСУС ХРИСТОС(имя ИИСУС кстати означает СПАСИТЕЛЬ). Но ЕГО за это РАСПЯЛИ. Но ОСТАЛОСЬ СВЯТОЕ ЕВАНГЕЛИЕ. Вот ЭТО и есть БОЖЕСТВЕННЫЕ УСЛОВИЯ , во первых ИЗБАВЛЕНИЯ ОТ ПЕРВОРОДНОГО ГРЕХА(а правильней сказать от ПОВРЕЖДЕНИЯ), И во вторых ДЛЯ СПАСЕНИЯ ДУШИ человеческой, ПОЛУЧЕНИЯ ЖИЗНИ ВЕЧНОЙ для ДУШИ, ПОСЛЕ физической СМЕРТИ тела , В ЦАРСТВИЕ НЕБЕСНОМ.

Ну И ЕСЛИ каждый человек захочет "БОРОТЬСЯ" СО своими ПОРОЧНЫМИ СТРАСТЯМИ , ТО для начала, НУЖНО ПОВЕРИТЬ В БОГА, ПРЕСВЯТУЮ ТРОИЦУ: ОТЦА(СОЗДАТЕЛЯ ВСЕГО ЖИВОГО И НЕ ЖИВОГО, ВИДИМОГО мира и НЕ ВИДИМОГО), СЫНА(ИИСУСА ХРИСТА), СВЯТОГО ДУХА.

А ЧТОБЫ "ПРИЙТИ" к БОГУ или ПОЗНАТЬ БОГА необходимо ПОКАЯНИЕ.

Ну А для того ЧТОБЫ ПОНЯТЬ ВСЁ что написано выше , И для ИСКРЕННЕГО ХРИСТИАНСКОГО ПОКАЯНИЯ, которое необходимо УСПЕТЬ(потому что ВРЕМЕНИ осталось очень МАЛО, возможно даже ПРИМЕРНО 8 МЕСЯЦЕВ, И ВСЁ(смотри СВЯТОЕ ЕВАНГЕЛИЕ от МАТФЕЯ, ГЛ. 24)) СДЕЛАТЬ при ЗЕМНОЙ ЖИЗНИ ЧЕЛОВЕКА, ПЕРВЫМ "шагом" будет (и как об этом уже упоминалось выше) ЧТЕНИЕ и ГЛАВНОЕ, ИЗУЧЕНИЕ КНИГИ ЖИЗНИ, СВЯЩЕННОГО ПИСАНИЯ НОВЫЙ ЗАВЕТ. ✋🏻

I always side eye commentary like this as it seems to suggest correlating being able to understand why a villain makes the decisions they make with justification for it. Even though Avatar is like a baton over the head with its message, the way you’re suggesting that the humans maybe aren’t bad is weird. Humans ARE the villains in this story. Regardless of their tech maybe being able to help.

The humans in Avatar attempted to colonize a planet, destroyed it in the process, then essentially forced the indigenous population to just accept their intrusion (example: like having to overlook humans hunting creatures that had significant social and spiritual value to them AND were sentient, social, intelligent beings).

The weakness in the writing isn’t because it doesn’t use the “both sides” approach. It’s the drawn out basic white savior narrative (Jake falling in love, saving them, AND inheritance of leadership. And whatever weird Kiri/Grace reincarnation and she gets special favor from their deity), lack of real conflict, and character dynamics that aren’t explored.

"You've done some terrible things, haven't you son?"

"You dare?! We stand at the precipice of greatness! Those who despised us, hunted us, who tore down our home and drove us from our lands, are now weak and vulnerable! You know why James Cameron CANT have the humans be sympathetic villains that are fighting 'for the greater good'???

Because environmental activists use the argument "for the greater good" to justify their insanely radical ideals. He absolutely cannot paint the humans in avatar be trying to save humans because that would open his eyes to the ugly reality that enacting those radical environmentalist laws and ideals would absolutely harm people.

The point is not that the Navi are "perfect", but the fact that they evolved into bonding with each other and with nature as a strategy, rather than evolving into competition, which is (imo) what we humans have done. I will not argue with anyone that believes the messages in the Avatar films are heavy handed, or clumsy/superficial, but I think the message of the movies is beautiful, even if it is a little simple, and the visuals are absolutely stunning.

I believe if you want political issues to be adressed properly maybe the entertainment industry is just not the pleace.

Your main concern is that the message is somewhat an overstatement, when it really isn't. You don't need the bad guys to have a greater reason for killing, we humans reslly are just like that. Take the european conquest. They didn't kill indians to save their families, it was done entirely out of greed and disrespect for foreign lives.

Avatar sucks because it's plain, not because its message isn't 'real' enough.

The problem is the nature of the politics pushed. No one can define it, because nearly no one has ever been taught what it is, and where it comes from. It's the Platonic ideal of the earth being the perfect place without any modern people, or without people at all. He's not demonizing technology, he's demonizing people, the very people watching the movie. If you watch the movie closely, technology is almost dismissed, things are used in ways they aren't intended and the tech is weaker than the natural animals of the planet. They have tech to put you in another body, yet they use Vietnam war era helicopter tactics. It has this very far left worship of "pure" science too, like engineering is bad, but biological research is good, the kind of study but don't disturb mentality, at least that was for the first movie.

People don’t love it for the story. They only love it for the cgi. 2009, was pretty understandable because compare Avatar to other movies during that time and you’d think that Avatar was made in 2016 or something, but no. It was 2009 and many people were very shocked. But now the sequel isn’t anything that special. Sure, Disney’s cgi might’ve gotten bad, but Avatar 2’s cgi isn’t better than cgi today. It’s comparable but people had the same reaction people did in 2009. Before I start watching this video, I'd like to share my opinions on the Avatar franchise.

Avatar was one of my favourite films due to the beauty of the world the movie has created, I love the design of the planet, the mysterious life forces, such and such etc. Because I was so fond of this first movie and I realized this movie was going to have a sequel with new Na'vi tribes being introduced, I was excited. I was looking forward to see how these tribes would be united to defeat the bad force once again, and I foolishly believed that the writing, the story, would be as good as the amount of effort in rendering the movie was going to be.
Avatar 2 was majorly disappointing to me. The graphics are beautiful, and I think no one is there to debate about that (except maybe for the face capture on one of the protagonist's daughters who has unexplained life magic, which was ugly and really off putting). But the story was absolutely disappointing. There's no better word to express my feelings on this movie, and the fact that I used disappointing twice should show that already.
The story was very cheap and leaves the audience with more questions, and the technology has been previously established in the last movie about how much it can do, however the main villain is fucking resurrected??? As a Na'vi???? Despite his corpse never retrieved on Pandora??? I watched both movies, and I don't remember any explanation for that. In addition to this cheesy main villain resurrection because no other fuck could've been the villain I guess, the return of humanity coming back to do the same fucking thing is ridiculous. It makes sense, until the ships land again as if the message hasn't been learned. Thinking about it now, the movie should've kept all the bases in space so that they'd have an advantage on preparation, as space is untouched by Na'vi.
Anyway, half-way through the movie it's all about the protagonists family, adjusting a new life... because bad guys are going to reach the floating rocks (AKA previous home) somehow. The move is understandable, for family concerns, and so is the protagonists wife's reaction, being angrry at having to move. But I noticed throughout the movie, that the protagonist, being a male, does not cry, and is very masculine, or "Alpha Male" for a simple description of his actions and reactions throughout the film. The wife was very emotional and feral like, animalistic, which I do not agree with because in the previous movie and even this one she is clearly good at fighting and reasoning, and to have her overly emotional in some parts was just annoying.
Not to mention the kids being kidnapped at least 3+ times just to move the plot forward, in addition to NONE of them getting traumatized. Like wtf???? Any kid would be fucking terrified to be held at gunpoint and they return to be kidnapped???? And then that one scene where the youngest boy bonds with a whale and the whale T-poses just has me rolling on the floor. Yes, that might be metaphorical or something, but you can't tell me a T-posing whale is funny af and kinda lazy- I don't have much experience in Blender (3D modelling platform) yet I can also T-pose a whale like that easily.
And that kid with life powers is so fucking unexplained like???? What was the point of that? That's just inserting a Mary Sue into the film.
Finally, we get to the end. Everything's on fire and kids save the day, mom threatened to kill her adopted fucking son (human) in exchange for the villain to stop killing her son/daughter can't remember which one which definitely should've traumatized Spider (the son)???? Like she cut his throat, blood clearly appeared there, and despite the villain being evil and everything when everyone was underwater trapped by the giant ship Spider SAVES HIM, AND RETURNS TO THE FAMILY WITH THE MOTHER WHO THREATENED AND ACTUALLY ALMOST KILLED HIM. AND IS HAPPY???
I remember in the trailer of this movie that thee protagonist was going around tribes asking for help. I was expecting a war, a united world against the Sky People. But instead I got Sully pretending to be a native (which is kinda insulting) and very masculine, his wife being just there, the unnecessary amount of children and their kidnapping and worst of all, resurrection of the villain established dead (and now also saved for fucking later movies).
A message about 'stop environmental destruction' again was better than this shit family trauma that doesn't even make sense or even give answers to the questions risen. I bet all these questions answers are saved for the next movie, which is an absolute shit move. The world had large potential; but the story/plot was absolutely shit and as the saying goes, a few bad apples spoil the bunch.

The all seem to have perfect heath, no dental carries, no congenital deformities, no bad eyesight, no hemophilia. Evidently there are no famines or plagues either. We starve, we catch Ebola, we are drowned in floods, freeze in blizzards, get eaten wolves and die helplessly when nature is indifferent to our welfare. I don't quite agree with the moral exploration argument. I don't think Lord of the Rings would benefit from an exploration of Sauron's merits, for example. I don't think Star Wars needed to spend time exploring how blowing up Alderaan was actually reasonable from the Imperial perspective. I don't need to hear arguments for why Odysseus is actually the bad guy for freeing his men from the Cyclops. It's okay to have villains in a story.

I agree that it is better to have a thorough examination, theoretically, and I enjoy many complex plots and characters myself. But it's literally wrong to say that a story needs that sort of complexity to be good.

These self-aware moral analyses appeal to the liberal's common sense of "innocent until proven guilty" and the good of the individual as the opposite of the evil of society. I like that stuff. But a black and white moral split absolutely works in its own right.

Does that make Avatar good? No. But I think it's very difficult to make demands of an entire art form (storytelling, in this case) to conform to any aesthetic universal. Not impossible, but extremely difficult to justify.

Lots of people didn't like Avatar, but a very considerable number of people did like it. That doesn't dictate quality, but it does suggest it.

A movie that does a better job at portraying an environmentalist theme and indigenous people is Princess Mononoke. The indigenous character San is a complex character, and so is the main antagonist Lady Eboshi. Lady Eboshi isn't bloodthirsty but does what she believes is right for the town she leads. San isn't a perfect person, she's distrusting of humans and aggressive, but she is still someone that viewers sympathize with and a beloved character by many (myself included). The thing that makes it work is that the antagonist and her town is endangered by something she does that harms an important nature spirit, and she is forced to change her ways. This works because many viewers like Eboshi, she genuinely wants the best for her town and people want to imagine how she improves once the movie ends.
